In addition, I will soon join my majority colleagues in cosponsoring legislation that would provide working and middle-class American families with at least $1,000 to help prepare and respond to the economic consequences of #COVID19. More on that to come.

Joined colleagues in a letter to Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, the Federal Housing Administration (FHA) and the Veterans Administration (VA) urging them to suspend foreclosure and eviction proceedings for the duration of the #coronavirus crisis.

Joined colleagues in a letter to @POTUS urging him to issue a mandate to allow federal employees to telework during COVID-19 crisis. I have already closed my offices in Washington and #NY16, and have asked my staff to telework from home.
Joined colleagues on a letter to the three major credit reporting agencies requesting they cease reporting adverse credit incidents during the pandemic.
Joined colleagues on a letter to the country’s major mortgage lenders urging them to stop foreclosure proceedings during the pandemic.

Joined colleagues in a letter to @NYGovCuomo, @CarlEHeastie and Majority Leader @AndreaSCousins urging a 90-day moratorium that would prevent landowners from evicting commercial tenants such as restaurants and bars because of the state-ordered closures.

Joined colleagues in a letter to @BetsyDeVosED making sure students aren’t hurt financially by this crisis. Americans need clarification on the Admin’s student debt relief, as well as tuition and housing reimbursements if their housing and semesters were cut short.

Joined the New York Delegation in a letter to @stevenmnuchin1 and @POTUS asking for the tax filing deadline to be extended. This will ease concerns about filling taxes and enable Americans to focus on their health during this crisis.

Cosponsored the COVID-19 Worker Protection Act, which would require the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) to ensure health care facilities implement infectious disease protocols to keep front line health care workers such as nurses safe.

Joined colleagues in a letter encouraging @POTUS to leverage the nation’s significant military assets to help combat the #coronavirus. This includes sending the Army Corp of Engineers to affected states like New York to help expeditiously build hospital capacity.
There’s been a lot of activity in Washington to combat #coronavirus and protect Americans during these difficult times. Here’s what I’ve been working on and signing onto during this crisis:
